This event celebrates 227 triumphant years of the American Experiment and the exceptional man who most embodied the dream of all men â the freedom to self-govern.Â OnÂ April 27, 2016 members of Congress, Christian leaders, and people of faith in homes and churches across the nation will join together to honor Washington as a man of Christian faith.Â Together, we will offer prayers on behalf of the nation, our President and his Cabinet, the Supreme Court and its Justices, and members of Congress.

Washington — A Man of PrayerÂ commemorates the events of April 30, 1789, when, after being sworn in at Federal Hall, President Washington, accompanied by Congress, proceeded to St. Paulâs Chapel where, as one of his first official acts, the president offered a prayer of dedication to God on Americaâs behalf.Â On that day, the world saw more than just the inauguration of the president of a new nation; it witnessed a watershed moment in history when the ideals penned in ink on parchment at Philadelphiaâs Continental Congress would preserve what sword and patriotsâ blood had inscribed on the field of battle.

Â FourÂ years ago, with the help of my good friend Representative Louie Gohmert, I presented the idea of this commemoration to Speaker of the House John Boehner.Â For the fourthÂ consecutive year, Speaker RyanÂ has granted us use of prestigious Statuary Hall, formerly the Old House Chamber, which was the location of weekly Christian church services from 1800 to 1869.Â It was actually the largest church on the east coast.Â Legislation allowing that use was signed into law by President Thomas Jefferson who attended there as did President Adams after him.Â These past threeÂ years, God has allowed us to do something that has not occurred in the Capitolâs Statuary Hall in over 100 years â a Christian led prayer event!
